Yet another rainy day

Olive's mum has her fingers crossed that the drop was just from some condensation on the leaves, and not a rain cloud overhead.

Did you know the south-west coast of the South Island has mountains that trap rainfall from the westerly air stream, and allowing them to receive 2,000–10,000 millimeters of rain per year? Only the highest mountain areas of the North Island receive a similar amount of rainfall.
